DataElement.preferredName: Hodgkin"s Lymphoma Complete Response First Observed Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date on which all criteria for clinical complete response for Hodgkin's lymphoma were first reported in a patient's medical records.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hodgkin's Lymphoma Complete Response First Observed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the first observed compete response of Hodgkin's lymphoma.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A lymphoma, previously known as Hodgkin's disease, characterized by the presence of Reed-Sternberg cells.  There are two distinct subtypes: nodular lymphocyte predominant Hodgkin's lymphoma and classical Hodgkin's lymphoma.  Hodgkin's lymphoma has a bimodal age distribution, and involves primarily lymph nodes.  Current therapy for Hodgkin's lymphoma has resulted in an excellent outcome and cure for the majority of patients. -- 2003:The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.  This does not always mean the cancer has been cured.  Also called a complete remission.

Concepts.definition: A lymphoma characterized by the presence of relatively few malignant cells called Reed-Sternberg cells and mononuclear Hodgkin cells that are admixed with nonneoplastic inflammatory cells. The malignant cells have a distinctive immunophenotype; they are positive for CD30 and CD15 and negative for CD3, CD20, and CD45.
The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.  This does not always mean the cancer has been cured.  Also called a complete remission.

Property.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:Observed; discovered or determined by scientific observation.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Ascertained or determined through monitoring or observation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
